answers.answer: Dr. Handsfield has already answered your question about HIV. The same is true for your questions about other STDs.  You do not have HIV or other STDs an do not need more testing for them,  If you are feeling poorly, you should discuss these concerns with an internal medicine specialist to look for other non-STD causes of your symptoms.Tingling is not a symptom of any STD. It is however a sign of anxiety.  Sometimes after an exposure that, in retrospect, one wishes they had not had, persons tend to examine themselves and be far more attuned to genital sensations than in periods when they are not concerned.  This in turn leads to noticing what turn out to be normal sensations that might have been not noticed or ignored at other times.  I suspect that this was a contributor to your situation.Similarly , most people with thrush do not have HIV. They have other problems such as diabetes or are at increased risk for thrush because of having taken antibiotics recently.  EWH
Thank you doctorYou saying i should stop for std but can discuss with my gp about my problems
thank you so much for your reply again but please what can cause to feeling cold on penis even cold sperms..please my last quiestion..many thanks :)

I'm sorry.  I cannot answer this question. The symptoms you describe are not symptoms of any STD and seems to be medicically unlikely. Again, I think you need to discuss this with your own doctor.  EWH

title: what more test i need?
